about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:

about.name: Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:

hasPart.assesses: Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often: | Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Continuous hard braking on snow and ice can result in the locking of the front brake, causing a loss of steering. To avoid the need for excessive braking, make sure to maintain an appropriate speed for conditions.

comment.text: Helps you stop faster.

suggestedAnswer.text: Locks the front wheels of a vehicle, causing a loss of steering.

comment.text: Locks the front wheels of a vehicle, causing a loss of steering.
Keeps the brakes from freezing.

acceptedAnswer.text: Locks the front wheels of a vehicle, causing a loss of steering.

comment.text: Locks the front wheels of a vehicle, causing a loss of steering.

answerExplanation.text: Continuous hard braking on snow and ice can result in the locking of the front brake, causing a loss of steering. To avoid the need for excessive braking, make sure to maintain an appropriate speed for conditions.

comment.text: Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often: | Continuous hard braking on snow and ice can result in the locking of the front brake, causing a loss of steering. To avoid the need for excessive braking, make sure to maintain an appropriate speed for conditions.

hasPart.name: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should:

about.name: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should:

hasPart.assesses: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should: | There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: At an intersection where traffic is not controlled by traffic signal lights, drivers are required to yield the right-of-way to pedestrians within any crosswalk, marked or unmarked. Even if there is no crosswalk, yield to the pedestrian.

suggestedAnswer.text: Make eye contact with and then pass the pedestrian.

comment.text: Make eye contact with and then pass the pedestrian.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down as you pass the pedestrian.

comment.text: Slow down as you pass the pedestrian.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

comment.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

comment.text: Stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.

answerExplanation.text: At an intersection where traffic is not controlled by traffic signal lights, drivers are required to yield the right-of-way to pedestrians within any crosswalk, marked or unmarked. Even if there is no crosswalk, yield to the pedestrian.

comment.text: There is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane ahead. hasPart.name: Which of the following increases your chances of being in a collision?

about.name: Which of the following increases your chances of being in a collision?

hasPart.assesses: Which of the following increases your chances of being in a collision? | Which of the following increases your chances of being in a collision? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Every time you pass another vehicle, you increase your chances of being in a collision.

suggestedAnswer.text: Looking over your shoulder while making lane changes

comment.text: Looking over your shoulder while making lane changes

suggestedAnswer.text: Continuously changing lanes to pass other vehicles

comment.text: Continuously changing lanes to pass other vehicles

suggestedAnswer.text: Adjusting your rearview mirror before you start driving

hasPart.name: This sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This sign means: | This sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that the roadway is slippery when wet.

comment.text: Do not drink and drive.
Slippery when wet.
Road curves ahead.
Slippery when wet.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that the roadway is slippery when wet.

comment.text: This sign means: | Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns that the roadway is slippery when wet.

hasPart.name: Where is it safe to pass another vehicle?

about.name: Where is it safe to pass another vehicle?

hasPart.assesses: Where is it safe to pass another vehicle? | Where is it safe to pass another vehicle? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Never pass within intersections or at other intersecting points, such as parking lot entrances and alleyways. Any time your view is blocked by a curve or a hill, you should stay in your lane and assume that there is an oncoming vehicle just out of sight. Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing other vehicles, you will have to determine whether or not you have enough space to pass in a safe manner.

suggestedAnswer.text: Within an intersection where there are no oncoming vehicles

comment.text: Within an intersection where there are no oncoming vehicles

suggestedAnswer.text: Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing

comment.text: Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing

suggestedAnswer.text: Within a curve where there are no oncoming vehicles

comment.text: Within a curve where there are no oncoming vehicles

acceptedAnswer.text: Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing

comment.text: Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing

answerExplanation.text: Never pass within intersections or at other intersecting points, such as parking lot entrances and alleyways. Any time your view is blocked by a curve or a hill, you should stay in your lane and assume that there is an oncoming vehicle just out of sight. Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing other vehicles, you will have to determine whether or not you have enough space to pass in a safe manner.

comment.text: Where is it safe to pass another vehicle? | Never pass within intersections or at other intersecting points, such as parking lot entrances and alleyways. Any time your view is blocked by a curve or a hill, you should stay in your lane and assume that there is an oncoming vehicle just out of sight. Wherever signs and/or pavement markings permit passing other vehicles, you will have to determine whether or not you have enough space to pass in a safe manner.
